text: The Bowman Mill Covered Bridge, in Perry County, Ohio, is a multiple kingpost truss covered bridge which was built in 1880. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978. It was a work of Lank Bowman. It has also been termed the Rush Creek Covered Bridge and the Readington Covered Bridge. It was located south of New Reading, on Winegardner Rd. It is now located in the Perry County Fairgrounds in Pike Township, at , at the intersection of Broadway (Ohio State Route 37) and Thorn Street near New Lexington.Tourism , Perry County Chamber of Commerce, 2013. Accessed 2013-05-16. It was moved to the fairgrounds in 1987 ==References== Category:Covered bridges in Ohio Category:National Register of Historic Places in Perry County, Ohio Category:Bridges completed in 1880
title: Bowman Mill Covered Bridge
